website_summaries.verdict: Minor quirks aside, this is a best-selling vegetarian cookbook with hundreds of chef-inspired recipes suitable for numerous types of meals, occasions, and cooks.
pros: Packed with 700 recipes for making everything vegetarian, from soups to side dishes and snacks to main courses
Includes numerous gluten-free and vegan recipes
Instructions are detailed and easy to follow
Available in paperback, spiral-bound, and on Kindle
cons: A few of the recipes are  elaborate, and many require eggs or cheese
The Kindle edition doesn't come with a table of contents

customer_reviews.title: Worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: I had read the reviews regarding the cheap binding on this cookbook, so I wasn't surprised to find the cover had separated from the book before I had even a removed it from the shipping package. But it was a simple task to run to the copy center to remove the spine and have the book spiral bound for $4.00. Cookbooks should be spiral-bound anyway to allow them to lay flat when you're using them. I love the recipes and all the hints in this cookbook, definitely worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Pyne

customer_reviews.title: Recipes full of cheese and cream
customer_reviews.text: Recipes may work for some but too many were packed with heavy cream and cheese. As this is not the way my family eats I returned.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Philbrook

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This book was geared toward experienced chefs and should have said so. Most ingredients are difficult for the average cook to find. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures, but unhealthy recipes.
customer_reviews.text: I did not have any problems with the binding on my cookbook. It's been a year and it's still fine. Lots of pictures, easy to follow instructions and no weird ingredients. I guess the only thing that bothers me about this cookbook is that quite a few of the recipes are really not healthy at all. Tons of cheese, eggs, dairy products and oil used in the recipes. My husband has some cardiac issues and there is a lot of cholesterol in these recipes. If you are looking for healthy recipes, this is definitely not the book for you. If you are only wanting recipes without meat, this is OK for you.
customer_reviews.author: karyn

customer_reviews.title: Get this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I chose to eat vegetarian a long time ago. And I hadn't purchased a cookbook for a long time, gathering recipes and tips randomly. This cookbook changed everything. In one place I found reliably excellent dishes that everyone will enjoy, non-vegetarians too. The authors' testing and research is sound. The resulting dishes are delicious. Nice pictures too. Prep instructions and equipment recommendations are thorough. What a joy! Get this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Drebelbis

customer_reviews.title: Crashes Kindle app
customer_reviews.text: The content of the book is great. I have used the hard copy in the past. However, the e-book crashes the Kindle app. There is also no accessible table of contents or a link to an index— I turn pages to see what’s in the book. I can get to certain pages and then the app won’t go past them. I try to use different navigations and the app has closed out. I have removed and downloaded the book several times and I have had same issues.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty complete 'fat' cookbook for a new or old vegetarian. I prefer my cookbooks spiral-bound, so I took it to FedEx and had it rebound for a few bucks. The index is 28 pages, there are many colored pictures, the ingredients and preparation details are excellent. I enjoy reading commentary on recipes, so it was not an overkill for me. I already have many cookbooks so I use this one mainly as a guide, although a straight forward follower of a recipe would find it good. I like that it gives you alternative choices in many recipes to suit your taste. or diet preferences.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book! Laughable binding.
customer_reviews.text: I had this book out for two three-month check-outs from my library system. Everything I made was amazing. The only problem with the book is that the construction is AWFUL. I mean... it's shameful that a cookbook was bound with this laughably cheap binding material. The glue barely held it together. BUT! I found a solution: I had a print shop put it on a spiral binding. It's not a perfect solution, but at least the pages won't go sliding across the counter when the spine gives way when I put it in my cookbook stand (oh yes, that happened). So: buy the book, but have it rebound.
customer_reviews.author: N. Tatjana C. Versaggi

customer_reviews.title: Recipes don't contain nutritional data.
customer_reviews.text: My new cookbook arrived today. The recipes look interesting and well explained. However, there is one major drawback, which may cause me to return this book. There is no nutritional information for any of the recipes. Conventional wisdom is that, if one eats a varied diet of fresh foods, nutritional needs will be met. Unfortunately, this really isn't enough for those with special dietary requirements. When eating animal products, protein needs are easily met (and frequently exceeded), but this is not necessarily true for plant-based diets. Please post nutritional data for your recipes, America's Test Kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Young

customer_reviews.title: BOOK FALLS APART! BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I have had this book a couple of months abd within the first week the binding fell apart . Now after using the new one twice the second on is falling apart. Pages falling everywhere abd I only used it TWICE.. SUCH A DISAPPOINTMENT. GOING TO TRY TO RETURN
customer_reviews.author: jeanne

customer_reviews.title: E-book functionality is a pain--buy the physical book
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook looks incredible but I sadly bought the e-book version. I purchased it after a dinner party a friend had with really great dishes prepared from its recipes. It is nearly impossible to navigate the Kindle version without going through the entire book to try and find the recipe you're looking for. There's no table of contents, index or even chapters in the functionality of it that I can find. (Is this a publisher's oversight or user error?) Basically, I feel like I've wasted money and will just be buying the physical book (begrudgingly) instead.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Some of my favorite recipes in here.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook and most every one of ATK recipes in general. This offers some of THE BEST vegetarian recipes. It’s hard to find a cookbook where you want to make every recipe, but this is one of those books. As a chef, I appreciate the care they take in making each recipe what they think is perfection. Sometimes the process they want you to follow is too involved so I just follow a standard approach with the same ingredients. I’ve found it doesn’t matter. If you think you like it, get it. You will! I recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: akash chinnam

customer_reviews.title: No Table of Contents or Index
customer_reviews.text: The table of contents is shadowed. Because it is not highlighted, it is not possible to open the table of contents on my iPad. To go to the table of contents, it is necessary to click the little picture of the magnifying glass that is used for a search. I am still trying to figure out how to find an index.
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Do not like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because a friend has the same book and I love hers. I'm not sure if this is a new edition, but it's completely different from hers. They are both the vegetarian America test kitchen books with the same picture on front. But they are laid out different inside and have different content.
customer_reviews.author: dancebear3

customer_reviews.title: A Cookbook Without Meat? Yes.
customer_reviews.text: I started my vegetarian diet about 4-5 months ago and, in the beginning, had a difficult time feeling satisfied with the meals that I cooked as they didn't seem hearty or at all interesting. This cookbook has a bunch of great vegetarian and vegan meal options with a bunch of variation that make me feel like I'm not making the same uninteresting thing every day. Now if I can just get people to stop acting weird once I tell them I'm a vegetarian I'd be all set!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Popek

customer_reviews.title: This book is HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: This book is huge. It has sooooo many great suggestions, but it's so big it's almost overwhelming. There's everything from fancy dinners to sandwiches. My only real complaint is that several recipes use texturized vegetable protein crumbles (bleh!). I'd rather make meatballs from real foods like mushrooms and lentils than a super processed meat substitute. But there's only a few of those.
customer_reviews.author: robin perry

customer_reviews.title: Vegeterian or not - go for this book!
customer_reviews.text: I don't consider myself a vegetarian, but I guess I am on a right path. Vegetarian or not, this book will not disappoint you! I have many cooking books and I try to stay away from "general" books, but wanted to have one that would be thorough on the vegetarian topic. Searched Amazon for a very long time, spent some time reading the comments and I must say that I am more than satisfy with the purchase. It is a great source on vegetarian or plant recipes. I only wish it had more pictures of dishes, but I understand that the book would be double the original size.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandra

customer_reviews.title: Want to level up your vegetarian cooking? This is the cookbook for you
customer_reviews.text: this just came today, and i’m so excited to dig in. As a omnivore, i want to expand my skills cooking vegetarian meals, and if that’s what you want too, this is the cookbook to get. Not only does it have delicious looking recipes, the book is filled with tips and education (see photos), for example “all about eggplants”, tips for when you’re shopping in the supermarket, what to look for, spices, asian sauces, etc etc etc. This seems like a must have for anybody who wants to up their vegetarian cooking game.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Nagi

customer_reviews.title: ... to get into cooking this book has been a great source of information
customer_reviews.text: Just starting out to get into cooking this book has been a great source of information. It's very clear and simple to make dishes, give a few words on them that is a nice addition. Also talks about how to cut vegetables and other cooking basics that I appreciated to have a quick reference to, especially since I was only expecting just straight recipes. The breakfast menu is a bit lacking in options is my biggest complaint so far. There is certainly a ton of content here and easy to sift through and come back to. Also the color key for denoting gluten free, vegan and fast cook times is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: Kindle version not recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Kindle edition is not recommended!!! There is no Table of Contents, no way to get to the various chapters, and no way to flick through it quickly to find what you're interested in. I bought it when it was a "Deal of the Day" only to find it isn't that much of a deal as I have to read through the whole book (470+ pages) and bookmark anything I want to find again. Tedious.
customer_reviews.author: M. Weisbeck

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this cookbook! I was about to give up on being a vegetarian, but the recipes I have made from the cookbook have made me excited about eating again. It took some adjusting for me, because most of the recipes take a lot of prep time. They do have some that are quicker, but every long recipe I have made has been worth it. My favorites so far are the Spinach Lasagna and the Ultimate Vegetarian Chili. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Heather P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Well-Rounded Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cookbooks whether you're a vegetarian or not. The recipes have a wide range and are unique in their own way. I like that each recipe has a "why this works" section that tells you why a particular recipes either represents the final outcome well or how it stands out from other recipes. Beyond just being an overall great cookbook, America's Test Kitchen proves that technique is the real winner. After cooking a few recipes you start to notice patterns that will enhance your overall cooking ability. Another win!
customer_reviews.author: Alex W. Camara

customer_reviews.title: Love the recipes, lots of pictures
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the recipes in this book--we are not an official vegetarian family, but wanted options that were meatless sometimes. I love that this book has pictures (not every recipe, but many). I am rating it 4 stars instead of 5 because the binding makes it a little tricky to keep open depending on where the recipe you're working from is located in the book. It wants to flip closed. If you're looking for some excellent ideas for meatless meals, this is the book for you!
customer_reviews.author: BoScha

customer_reviews.title: Poor especially for a novice cook!
customer_reviews.text: Most recipes good, but some poor. The cauliflower and Marsala on page 67 calls for a cup of tomatoe paste, and it”s horrible. There are typos, incomplete instructions, very unclear instructions, etc. The recipe for Zucchini and White Bean Stew on page42 calls for 1/4 ounce mushrooms. REALLY...very poorly written book.
customer_reviews.author: D W P

customer_reviews.title: Great for Anyone!
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT a vegetarian, yet was looking for some meat-free meals to add to the family menu a few days a week... This is an AWESOME book! I have made about ten of the recipes since buying this book a few weeks ago. They have all been fantastic; nutritious, relatively quick and easy, and I didn't have to buy half of the grocery store to make them. (The eggplant rolatini has been a huge favorite! As well as the tart on the front cover!) I would recommend this book to any level of home cook. It's also got some fun and helpful hints included between recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Brwinsegg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Easy, Mouth watering recipes
customer_reviews.text: Out if all the cook books we've purchased, Test Kitchen have the "BEST". They want perfection so they keep redoing a recipe until they find the best ingredients that work. It's been 5 months on a plant based diet , who would ever have thght the flavors would be so unbelievably orgasmic! Yeah, I know, right, especially living 50+ years eating meat (which I loved). I gave my rating 4 stars because the 2nd time opening the book it's all coming apart. I should gave listened to other reviews & ordered the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're skeptical of skipping meat, try these delicious recipes!
customer_reviews.text: We resolved in 2019 to make at least one vegetarian meal per week. But the recipes in this book were so delicious (and usually very easy), that we ended up making more and more from the book beyond our resolution. Our favorites are the Vegetable Lasagna, Ratatouille, Chickpea and vegetable curry, Quinoa and vegetable stew, and poblano enchiladas.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R

customer_reviews.title: The cookbook I've used the most
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I invested in this cookbook. America's Test Kitchen knocks it out of the park time and again, so that you don't have to worry about taking a risk by trying something new. If you need some fresh new ideas for meatless meals, no matter if you're vegetarian or not, you will not be disappointed. I have never tried so many recipes from one cookbook in such a short time, and I've only been scratched the surface. My family has been blown away with each and every new thing I've tried. Do not hesitate to buy this book.
customer_reviews.author: Sandalwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes!!! if you can find them
customer_reviews.text: The recipes are great and easy to follow. The index and the format of the book is poorly done and therefore it is difficult to locate recipes. The binding of the book is poor quality and the book cover is coming off of the book.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Staton

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and clear, but no prep or cook times
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully delicious recipes and really clear instructions. I love that it has a guide on how to pick vegetables, tips on how to peel, cut and prepare them. Two wishes: (1) There were more photos of dishes and (2) (the main complaint) there were a prep and cook time listed w/ the recipes. It stars "fast" recipes but has no times listed. (The only fast recipes we've tried so far aren't that fast - This is more of a book to use if you have leisure time to spend cooking a fantastic meal.)
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great all around cook book and very well organized/written
customer_reviews.text: My Husband and I just decided to go vegetarian...a bit daunting to say the least. This is a great all around cook book and very well organized/written. For those of us who really don't cook and meander around the produce isle wondering what all these different types of produce are and how to cook and prepare them...this book is for you! Covers all the basics(even what basic spices etc. you should have on hand) and has great recipe's, also love the fact that it tells you if how easy/quick each recipe is to prepare. Would absolutely purchase again as a gift for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Buckley

customer_reviews.title: approachable
customer_reviews.text: I've long been a fan of cooks illustrated magazine and ATK. These people are into both the science and art behind their recipes and I have found them to be absolutely foolproof. This vegetarian cookbook has become my go to. Along with superb recipes, this book offers a boatload of info on ingredients and why a particular recipe works. BUY IT. YOU'LL USE IT OFTEN.
customer_reviews.author: Darkeyes

customer_reviews.title: Great book, very helpful, good recipes
customer_reviews.text: I really like that they have a “prep school” in the beginning of the book. They have lots of helpful tips on how to cut veggies a certain way, kitchen gadgets that are worth it, which knives are useful for cutting certain things, what stuff you don’t really need. The recipes look good. I’ve only tried one so far, which was good. I can’t wait to try more. I will definitely be buying their other books.
customer_reviews.author: Howard B

customer_reviews.title: No table of contents kindle edition..
customer_reviews.text: No table of contents kindle edition makes this book hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jagerson

customer_reviews.title: Delicious - yet to make something not amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have been cooking through all of the recipes, and I have been pleased with every one thus far. I like the directions, and have found, that even if you goof up a little, the recipe still is amazing! Meat eaters are enjoying the food too. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa V

customer_reviews.title: Nice cookbook but not for me
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this cookbook is not for me. I am allergic to eggs, soy, and gluten and the recipes in this cookbook rely heavily on those ingredients. Since I could only really use a subset of the recipes, I returned the book. I am sure it is a nice cookbook for someone without my allergies, though.
customer_reviews.author: PKLK

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I'm a vegetarian. For me, this is the best cookbook I've ever used. I've probably tried a dozen recipes so far, and every one has turned out perfectly. It's obvious the recipes are thoroughly tested before they go in the book. And it's so full of ideas, I could probably cook out of it for the rest of my life without trying them all.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Jones

customer_reviews.title: ... received this as a surprise Christmas gift and I love it. It is such a great book
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a surprise Christmas gift and I love it. It is such a great book. Very detailed in recipes, gives great information on every single recipe on what works, what to sub, what not, and how to make each recipe great. There is a full chapter on cutting/slicing/dicing how-to's on different vegetables, which is very helpful. This book also gives lists of essential kitchen tools and how they will help you as you chef along. I have tried two recipes and they were both fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful book and a veggie game changer for me!
customer_reviews.text: Kind of in awe of this book. Beautiful pictures and every single recipe looks absolutely incredible and doable. I'm so looking forward to making every one of them! And while I realize that we live in the age of Google, and you can now easily look up recipes, the value of this book is that they are all in one place and you don't have to come up with them off the top of your head. They are super creative and presented in a way that makes sense. Would highly recommend it to everyone, from those looking to just add some more vegetables to their diets, to vegetarians like myself looking to expand their veggie horizons.
customer_reviews.author: bananna

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I love finding way to make vegetables the center of a meal, rather than meat, but that can be hard to do- to make it feel like it's a full meal and not just a side. So far I've tried 5 Recipes. Four were fabulous, the fifth was okay, but that's a great ratio for a cookbook. There are so many unique flavors in this too- from all over the world. I'm loving it, and I have dozens highlighted I'm excited to make. I'm so glad I found this.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Good Cookbook, Cheap Binding
customer_reviews.text: The content of this cookbook is great. In love the recipes. Highly recommend them. However, the binding is cheap. Pages began falling out after owning this book for a week. Going to have to figure out how to organize the book since the binding isn't built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook. Everything in there actually looks appealing
customer_reviews.text: Great cookbook. Everything in there actually looks appealing, as opposed to literally any other vegetarian cook book. Lots of tasty looking curries and things. As someone who is in a half veg/half carnivore household, these are great for food that both of us will like.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent recipes but poorly constructed book.
customer_reviews.text: I love yeh recipes in this cookbook. Typical ATK recipes with several steps which does make for an excellent result. But 3 stars because the recipes often are on pages which require turning the pages while cooking. And book is poorly constructed and is already falling apart after only 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Iowa city doc

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes and cooking tips
customer_reviews.text: This cook book is way more thorough than I expected. It thoroughly explains many vegetables used in the recipes: how to prepare/cut them, how they're often served, and how to keep the vegetables fresh. I've tried maybe a dozen of the recipes so far and have not been disappointed once. Everything is fun, flavorful, and filling. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Smith

customer_reviews.title: Binder Broke
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Cookbook cookbook in February. We browsed through the recipes. First time we used it the Book spine separated from the pages. I have tons of Recipe books and I have never had this happen before.
customer_reviews.author: RoDe

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We haven't been disappointed yet with these recipes. Well, we didn't love the tagine recipe, but I have to admit on that one that we didn't follow the instructions. The only thing I don't like is all the recipes I've seen call for canned legumes, but we just substitute 1.75 cups of our home cooked legumes for the number of cans they require in a recipe. It works out exactly right that way. I do think they underestimate the servings though. Where they say 4-6, I would say 8-10. I mean, the tagine recipe called for 8 servings of chickpeas, but then said it served 4-6. We got 8 from it.
customer_reviews.author: Wandalynette

customer_reviews.title: Best vegetarian recipes I've found
customer_reviews.text: America's test kitchen has awesome recipes, almost every one is a winner. Please be aware though, these are not quick recipes. I don't think I've found one yet that's taken less that one hour (one hour of my time, not just cook time). I don't mind though, these are solid, healthy recipes. Quality, nutritious food takes time.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: So much more than just recipes
customer_reviews.text: Amazing cookbook with not just tons of recipes, but also a lot of tips, techniques and info on ingredients. As a major foodie, I'm in love with this book. I've had great luck with their standard cookbook, but recently wanted to have more vegetarian meals in my diet and knew they'd have a lot to offer. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Y

customer_reviews.title: Best vegetarian cook book option
customer_reviews.text: If you are a vegetarian or want to become one, you need this book! Must have for anyone who want to eat delicious, better foods. Instructions are well written. This is a huge book. After a few uses the spine broke. Contacted customer service and my new book was delivered next day! Again, this is an awesome cookbook and my new favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Karen R Mager

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone can make breakfast or lunch vegetarian, but my wife and I struggled to make dinners that were both vegetarian and filling/ satisfying. We are not vegetarian, but are trying to scale back on the amount of meat we eat. This recipe book really shows how to make delicious dishes with well developed flavors and you can use the techniques in here on lots of other recipes to make them vegetarian or to make them taste better.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Brown

customer_reviews.title: Eating you veggies is a pleasure with these recipes
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Everything that I have made from this cookbook was delicious. My family never missed the meat and the flavors were wonderful. There are so many options to choose from and I have made 2-3 recipes each week for months with much success. I especially loved the leek, olive and feta puff pastry. My husband's fav was the broccoli rabi with farro. My daughter begs me to make the warm cole slaw with tofu. This book made going vegetarian easy.
customer_reviews.author: phantom phiddler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Goes into detail from picking veggies, how to cut them, best combinations, cooking do's and don'ts and, of course, amazing recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Despair

customer_reviews.title: but the recipes we've tried so far have been great. The cauliflower curry is a new staple and ...
customer_reviews.text: A little bit overwhelming, and much bigger than I realized, but the recipes we've tried so far have been great. The cauliflower curry is a new staple and I look forward to using the same sauce recipe with other vegetables. Lots of great info and ideas in the front of the book as well, and great photos throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Love the Cookbook, Hate the Binding
customer_reviews.text: The recipes in this cookbook are awesome, but after using the cookbook a couple of times, the binding fell apart. I work at a library and handle a lot of books... this shouldn't happen.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hammond Hagberg

customer_reviews.title: Don't be a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a beginner level cookbook. If you are someone who has some experience in the kitchen then I would get this. Although the book tries to appeal to a beginner but you will get quickly overwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Wallace

customer_reviews.title: LOT OF DAIRY
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THE RECIPIES THE ONLY THING THAT I DIDNT LIKE AND I AM A LIL DISAPPOINTED IS THAT MOST OF THE RECIPIES HAVE MILK, CHEESE AND BUTTER AS INGREDIENT S
customer_reviews.author: daniela salgado

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have in the Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a vegetarian, but I wanted a cookbook that would help me learn to cook vegetables in a new way. I'd been searching for a while before I stumbled on this one. I love this cookbook. The recipes vary from super simple to pretty complicated. There are explanations and tips including how to store your veggies, why they created recipes the way they did, and much more. These tips are wonderful. Extremely impressed and happy with this. You don't have to be a vegetarian to reap the benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Expands on classic cookbooks by covering vegetarian cooking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old grandson who wants to be a vegetarian. It is a hefty volume of recipes with precise descriptions of the best techniques for cutting vegetables and a thorough review of a wide variety of grains. An impressive book for beginning, experienced or adventurous cooks.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline B.

customer_reviews.title: A book you can trust
customer_reviews.text: Great source of recipes and info. All recipes made are excellent. Some with adult sophisticated flavor (not complaining about it) which is something we need every once In a while.
customer_reviews.author: Rosebuds007

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for a book
customer_reviews.text: The recipe are great for my first vegetarian book BUT the quality of the book binding is terrible. It continues to fall apart and I'm holding it together with scotch tape. The pictures are beautiful, descriptions are good but you can't pick up the book without losing a page or two.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hood

customer_reviews.title: The end to a lifelong search for the perfect cookbook. EUREKA! I have found it!
customer_reviews.text: This cook book is the best guide to cooking all things vegetarian I have ever found. For 40 years I have sought one guide that would help me create amazing, tasty, healthy food. Every recipe resonates with me, the ingredients are easy to find and used with great care to create balance. The flavors are spot on and the authors give easy to follow, quality instruction that help the home cook prepare restaurant quality dishes that have umami. My kitchen only needs one cookbook these days and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: KelleyArt4Life

customer_reviews.title: Only a couple good sounding choices
customer_reviews.text: OK, has pictures but no Calorie, Sodium, o Carb counts. Only a couple good sounding choices. This is probably going to end up in the Goodwill donation box.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Sisco

customer_reviews.title: Too many dairy based recipes
customer_reviews.text: I have hardly used it due the large amount of dairy based recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I have ever tried a cookbook from America's Test Kitchen that I didn't like. This does not disappoint! I bought this after I had borrowed it from the library, renewed it 10 times, and didn't want to take it back! Every recipe in this book that I have tried has been fantastic! My family is not vegetarian, but I am always trying to get everyone to eat more healthy, and this has been a good way for me to do that. With this book, you can cook vegetarian meals, and not compromise on great taste.
customer_reviews.author: pepperlarue

customer_reviews.title: A Great Cookbook for Eating Healthier
customer_reviews.text: We often watch America's Test Kitchen, and many of the recipes on the shows are in this cookbook. The recipes we've tried have been delicious and have ingredients that are not exotic or expensive and are easily found in markets. I would have given it five stars, but it did not contain nutritional information about each recipe, which would have been nice as we like to track our calories, sodium, fat, etc. intake. This is probably not a good choice for beginner cooks as it does not contain step-by-step instructions, but we are advanced cooks, so that is not an issue to us. Overall, it is a great cookbook with nice photos of finished dishes.
customer_reviews.author: CRBMD

customer_reviews.title: Great for non-vegetarians too!
customer_reviews.text: I own a lot of America’s Test Kitchen cookbooks and I’m excited that I found this one. I’ve been trying to eat less meat but was having a hard time with meals that still felt filling. ATK knocked it out of the park as usual. I haven’t had something I don’t like from here and I’ve been using it 3-4 times a week for the past 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah C

customer_reviews.title: It's OK if you have the time
customer_reviews.text: The recipes are too elaborate. Definitely a lot more work than I want to do during the week. I'm a good cook, but the recipes in here are too complex.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I use it quite often! There are so many options & types of cuisines! I would’ve liked to see the approximate prep and cook times, but they do label “fast” dishes ( as well as vegan and gluten free). I appreciate the guides & tips & have learned some handy tricks to use in the kitchen. Most of the dishes turn out pretty well (the not as exciting ones may be user error, of course), but some seem to be a little more effort than they’re worth. More wins than duds.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: An outsatnding cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully illustrated book full of recipes that appear to be both nourishing & delicious. I am not a vegetarian & was hoping to find a book with recipes that were appealing, satisfying, not too involved, & with ordinary ingredients. I have found it in this book.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would have more main meal recipes than it had. It as disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Svehla,Rick Svehla,Rick Svehla,Rick Svehla

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Hoped For, And Got. - A WINNER !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed with this wonderful cookbook. I've never had a more helpful cookbook in my life. It is more than a bunch of recipes, it is a primer on so much about cooking and the utensils and spices, I can't begin to list all the reasons this is PERFECT. We are mostly vegetarian, but occasionally add fish and chicken to our meals. I needed a guide for making veggie cooking good and interesting....this goes far beyond my expectation. You can't miss with this one. I use it for meal planning. Not only do you get the recipe, but why the recipes WORKS so well.
customer_reviews.author: BeverleeC

customer_reviews.title: Not the usual vegetarian cookbook.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I was looking for a vegetarian cookbook that wasn't full of the usual stuff. I have been a fan of some of the Moosewood cookbooks, but it has been ten years and they were getting old. There are quite a few ethnic dishes, eggs as main dishes and we LOVE the veggie burgers. They were a hit!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Cookbook!.
customer_reviews.text: This It’s a terrific Cookbook. It has an enormous number of excellent recipes that can be used to completely replace need in your diet. However, you don’t have to. The photography is beautiful. One of the best cook books I have.
customer_reviews.author: Ping Bull

customer_reviews.title: Book fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Recipes are good, but book quality is poor. The cover separated from the main pages very quickly. I purchased the soft cover version. Hard cover would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Great cookbook! I am fairly new to vegetarianism and this recipe book has lots of helpful tips. The recipes I've attempted so far have turned out very well and there's really nothing in the book that's crazy difficult. Plenty of the recipes are veg spins on traditional meat dishes which has made the transition easier. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best vegetarian cookbook I own
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite vegetarian cookbook. The recipes are not too difficult, but they're excellent, and the editors tell you how they developed the recipes (why this recipe works) which is really interesting generally. The recipes are color-coded (fast, vegan) and tell you how many each recipe will serve, which is helpful. My husband, who is a meat-eater, raves about the recipes I make from this cookbook, and never complains that we aren't having meat when I cook from it.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Janack

customer_reviews.title: Really Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know that this book was going to have as many recipes as it did so when I picked it up, I was shocked at how heavy and thick it was!! I wanted to get more dinner ideas since I was more of a "find what's in the kitchen and throw it all together into something" kind of person. I was never really a meat person, so this book is perfect!! I also love the different sections, very organized.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This book is extremely helpful and is easy to understand. It shares great tips, includes lots of illustrations, and provides a variety of different recipes. Although the spine of the book started to separate and some of the pages began to fall out. I didn't like that it happened but it wasn't a deal breaker for me. Overall, I am satisfied with this purchase and I might just buy another cookbook from this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Very illustrative and recipes are easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: This book works very well! It explains everything including how to cut different types of veggies. The recipes are easy to follow, and they are good for everyday easy dinner and also dinner parties for the holiday!
customer_reviews.author: Pet Lover #1

customer_reviews.title: The best cookbook. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: This book is wonderful. There are a ton of recipes and lots of pictures. There is also a great index which tells you the pages with recipes for a specific food item. It also has a tutorial section in the beginning of the book with pictures and descriptions of differ cookware, cutting techniques, sauces, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel's Menagerie

customer_reviews.title: Not just for strict vegetarians
customer_reviews.text: This is great for vegetarians, or even just for people that want to cook more vegetarian meals. We love lots of their recipes and have found some great new standbys! Anything out of America's Test Kitchen is great! There are lots of recipes for veggie sides as well. And they have a good system of rating "fast" "easy" etc.
customer_reviews.author: A. Galdi

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed at first
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed at first. I think because the format is a little different than other ATK cookbooks. But this turned out to be a great purchase. I've only made 3 things but all 3 turned out wonderful. The best Broccoli Salad I've ever had. I can't wait to work my way through this book
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Much more than the 700 recipes
customer_reviews.text: I loved the introduction to utensils, spices, staples needed. Previously, I had not known items what I needed in the kitchen including basic utensils. This is my go-to book. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: You don't have to be a vegetarian to purchase this great recipe book!
customer_reviews.text: My 23 year old daughter isn't a true vegetarian but she does like to limit the amount of meat she eats. I purchased this book for a Christmas present for her as she just got married over Thanksgiving and is becoming quite the cook. This book is of good quality, has a lot of recipes, and nice pictures of the food in it. She was very happy with it! Plus I did not have to pay shipping costs with my Amazon Prime membership which really helps my budget!
customer_reviews.author: Demo Deb

customer_reviews.title: A must cookbook for every kitchen
customer_reviews.text: A MUST cookbook for all. I've been a fan of AMT for years and subscribed to their monthly and annual books but recently changed to a vegetarian diet and was looking for a comprehensive book instead of pouring over several years of vegetarian recipes in past issues. This cookbook does all that for you with updated and delicious recipes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Madisongulf

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow, helpful, and delicious recipes!
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing! I'm not good at cooking and know very little about cooking. But I recently decided to adopt a vegetarian lifestyle and cook for myself. It was a challenge until I found this book. This book has easy to follow recipes, and it teaches you things as well. All the recipes I've tried so far have been delicious and pretty easy, if occasionally time consuming. My significant other is not a vegetarian but has loved all the dishes I've made with this book. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kate B.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my best friend. She was very pleased to see it was by Americas Test Kitchen. I did a lot of research before purchasing this specific cookbook and this seemed to be the best for my money.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Stage

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: I love American Test Kitchen cookbooks and this one does not disappoint. As usual it has lots of helpful information. Details on vegetables, how best to store etc, information on knives - as you do a lot of chopping when you cook vegetarian. We have tried 15 recipes so far and we have loved each and everyone. They also have a legend with each recipe letting you know if it is quick to make.
customer_reviews.author: Rednell

customer_reviews.title: Hard recipes
customer_reviews.text: Some good recipes but quite a few have way too many ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am still not bored of the recipes
customer_reviews.text: Ive been a vegetarian over 10 years now and ive had this book for about 3 years...I am still not bored of the recipes. They arent all winners, but in general it has a great variety. The book is color coded for gluten free and vegan also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for getting the carnivore in your life to like veggies
customer_reviews.text: This is the vegetarian cookbook I have been waiting for! I have been trying to transition from a meat-at-every-meal style to more vegetarian meals but have a somewhat skeptical husband and a limited knowledge of how to make good vegetarian meals. This cookbook is huge / comprehensive, and is full of hearty and delicious recipes. America's Test Kitchen never disappoints, but this is truly a gem!!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: My husband and I were wanting to eat less meat ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were wanting to eat less meat so I borrowed this book from a friend. I used it so much that I eventually just bought myself the book. It has a variety of delicious recipes. It is a very helpful cookbook especially for someone that is new to vegetarian cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my cookbook collection.
customer_reviews.text: I like this book! Recipes are concise and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Walksincircle

customer_reviews.title: Easy Tasty Recipes
customer_reviews.text: Everything I have made from this book has been very tasty. The recipes are straightforward using ingredients that are readily found in most groceries or on Amazon. These are not complicated recipes either. As in other Test Kitchen books, they also explain why their approach works and what does not. The time involved for most makes them doable on week nights too.
customer_reviews.author: V. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes, fragile binding
customer_reviews.text: The recipes are varied, well thought out, and simple to follow. The fideos recipe is amazing! The potato vindaloo recipe served as my gateway into cooking Indian food (it's actually not that hard). I would have given it 5 stars if the binding wasn't complete junk. I've owned this for a year now and the cover has completely separated from the spine, which is now held together with gaffer's tape. Re-print this as a proper hardcover, and I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cookbook for vegetarians!
customer_reviews.text: Love this book. Encyclopedia of information. First recipe made, eggplant stuffed with bulgur, was meatless and such a winner. Also recommend the spiral binding. It’s a thick book and will lay flat and not hurt the binding.
customer_reviews.author: platycodyn

customer_reviews.title: Amercia's test Kitchen is the best
customer_reviews.text: look who makes this book- AMERICAS TEST KITCHEN- IT IS FULL OF RECIPES! the best thing about americas test kitchen. is they have done all the research for you. .they tell you why their way works, and most of the recipes i have loved, I can see them make on Youtube to make sure if i mess up, where and how. I would recommend any cook book they have. This one and the Vegan one are great for me as im not either but have customers that are. trust these guys. almost anyone in the kitchen does one way or another....
customer_reviews.author: Chef K.C.G

customer_reviews.title: Great Vegetarian Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome cookbook. Great directions, and a huge variety of recipes to choose from. We've made several dishes. My favorite so far is saag with paneer. We actually made our own paneer! Even the meat-eaters in my family enjoy recipes from this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Shazam

customer_reviews.title: Grandson says he loves the recipes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson, who has decided to eat vegetarian.. He says he loves it.. I wish I'd copied some of the recipes, as they do look very tasty.. May have to buy a book for myself!
customer_reviews.author: KarenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookbook But Pages Are Falling Out
customer_reviews.text: I love the recipes and the content in this cookbook BUT the pages are falling out of the binding of this paperback cookbook. I have treated the cookbook with care but the pages are still falling out, and it seems that the book binding is just not well constructed. If there is a hardcover version I would recommend purchasing that edition instead.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-MNT

product_meta.title: The Complete Vegetarian Cookbook: A Fresh Guide to Eating Well With 700 Foolproof Recipes
